publisher.name: Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

licence.p: The Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) licence applies to this document.

sourceDesc.p: This is a born digital document

projectDesc.p: This document was created and is made available in the framework of the project "The Shawi-type Arabic dialects". This project has received funding from the Austrian Science Fund (FWF) under the grant agreement No. P 33574.

prefixDef.p: In the context of the SHAWI project, references using the "corpusmd" prefix point to any element in the corpus metadata document via its ID.
In the context of the SHAWI project, references using the "texts" prefix point to an XML document in the paratext directory.

revisionDesc.change: set up templates for SHAWI paratexts

div.head: Team
div.p: The SHAWI Team is made up of experts both from the field of Arabic Variantional linguistics and the digital humanities.

div.head: Stephan Prochàzka
div.p: The project is lead by Stephan Procházka, Institute of Oriental Studies, University of Vienna

div.head: Charly Mörth
div.p: … is research director of the Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage of the Austrian Academy of Sciences and acts as the national research partner.

div.head: Miriam Al Tawil
div.p: … is a researcher at the Institute of Oriental Studies and has transcribed and annotated the SHAWI corpus.

div.head: Aozan Hussien
div.p: … is a researcher at the Institute of Oriental Studies and has transcribed and annotated the SHAWI corpus.

div.head: Mau Abraham
div.p: … has been working on the integration of the SHAWI corpus in the VICAV application framework.

div.head: Levente Kiraly
div.p: … is reimplementing the frontend of VICAV, which the SHAWI application is built upon.

div.head: Omar Siam
div.p: … acts as the project's interface to the ACDH-CH's infrastructure unit and coordinates the frontend reimplemntation of VICAV.

div.head: Christoph Hoffmann / Stefan Probst
div.p: Leads of the ACDH-CH's Frontend Team have shared much of their expertise to the application's user interface, making sure it is aligned with current best-practices.
